Are you sure, you want to disagree?
I have read and accept the Terms Of Service.

Checklist Claims, LLC

End user beta testing

SOFTWARE LICENSE AGREEMENT

CAREFULLY READ THE FOLLOWING LICENSE AGREEMENT WHICH IS A LEGALLY BINDING AGREEMENT. YOU ACCEPT AND AGREE TO BE BOUND BY THIS END USER BETA TESTING LICENSE AGREEMENT (“AGREEMENT”) BY CLICKING THE ICON LABELED “I ACCEPT” THAT IS DISPLAYED BELOW. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THIS LICENSE, CLICK THE ICON LABELED “CANCEL” AND YOUR ORDER WILL BE CANCELED, THE SOFTWARE WILL NOT BE DOWNLOADED, INSTALLED, OR STARTED.

1.LICENSE GRANT. “You” or “Licensee” means the person or company who is being licensed to use the Checklist Claims™ beta software. “We,” “us,” “our,” and “Licensor” means Checklist Claims, LLC, a Washington State Limited Liability Company, having principal offices at 7204 NE 175th Street, Kenmore, WA 98028 (“Licensor”).

1.1Software License Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Licensor hereby grants You a royalty-free, personal, nonexclusive, nontransferable and revocable license to access and use the Software solely for purposes of “live” testing and evaluation of the Software. No license is granted for any other purpose and there are no implied licenses in this Agreement.

1.2Limitations. You agree not to modify, translate, reproduce, disassemble, decompile, reverse engineer, or create derivative works based on or copy the Software and will not rent, transfer, or permit access to the Software to any third party.

1.3Support. Licensor may provide training and technical support for the Software and may provide updates, bug fixes, or error corrections. If Licensor provides any such items, they will be considered to be part of the Software and subject to the terms of this Agreement. All expenses associated with such support shall be provided at no cost to You.

2.OWNERSHIP. You acknowledge and agree that Licensor owns and retains all right, title, and interest in and to the Software, including, without limitation, all copyrights, patents, trade secrets, trademarks, and other intellectual and proprietary property rights therein. You agree not to use Licensor’s trademarks or other business names for any purpose or to take any actions which are harmful to or inconsistent with Licensor’s rights in its trademarks, service marks, and trade names. You will not earn or acquire any rights or licenses under any copyright, patent, trade secret, trademark, or other intellectual or proprietary property rights on account of this Agreement.

3.NONDISCLOSURE.

3.1Confidential Obligations. You agree to hold the Software and related information, whether disclosed in written or oral format, including information that is proprietary to a third party (collectively referred to as the “Confidential Information”) in strict confidence and not to use or disclose the Confidential Information, in whole or in part, except as expressly permitted in this Agreement. You may disclose the Confidential Information to employees of Licensee, but only to the extent they have a need to know to test and evaluate the Software and You advised them that such information is Confidential. You agree to instruct any such employees in advance who will have access to the Software that they must comply with the restrictions set forth in this Agreement with respect to the Software. Licensor agrees to hold all information learned or revealed to it by You during the term hereof as confidential, however, Licensor may use such Confidential Information pursuant to the terms of Section 7.3.

3.2Exceptions. Either party shall have no obligation to maintain the confidentiality of any information which:

(a)is or becomes publicly available without breach of this Agreement;

(b)is rightfully received by the receiving party from a third party without an obligation of confidentiality and without breach of this Agreement;

(c)is developed independently by receiving party without access to or use of the Confidential Information; or

(d)has been approved for release by written authorization of disclosing party.

4.licensee’s undestanding of nature of software. You acknowledge and agree that:

(a)the Software has not been commercially released for sale by Licensor;

(b)the Software may not be in final form or fully functional and it is expected that it may contain errors, design flaws, or other problems which cannot or will not be corrected by Licensor;

(c)the Software and its use may result in unexpected results, loss of data, project delays, or other unpredictable damage or loss to You;

(d)Licensor is under no obligation to release a commercial version of the Software and any commercial product released may not be backward compatible and/or the programming interfaces may change; and

(e)Licensor has the right to unilaterally abandon development of the Software at any time and without any obligation or liability to You or any third party.

5.Disclaimer of Warranties; Limitation of Liability.

5.1Disclaimer of Warranties. THE SOFTWARE IS BEING SUPPLIED TO YOU ON AN “AS IS WITH ALL FAULTS” BASIS WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND. ALL EXPRESS OR IMPLIED CONDITIONS, REPRESENTATIONS, AND WARRANTIES INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE, NONINFRINGEMENT OR ARISING FROM A COURSE OF DEALING, USAGE, OR TRADE PRACTICE, ARE HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMED BY LICENSOR. LICENSOR DOES NOT WARRANT, GUARANTEE, OR MAKE ANY REPRESENTATIONS REGARDING THE USE OR THE RESULTS OF THE USE OF THE SOFTWARE IN TERMS OF ITS CORRECTNESS, ACCURACY, RELIABILITY, CURRENTNESS, OR OTHERWISE. THERE IS NO GUARANTEE THAT THE FUNCTIONS CONTAINED IN THE SOFTWARE WILL MEET YOUR REQUIREMENTS, OR THAT THE OPERATION OF THE SOFTWARE WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE, OR THAT DEFECTS IN THE SOFTWARE WILL BE CORRECTED. LICENSOR DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SOFTWARE WILL WORK CORRECTLY IN A MULTI-USER OR NETWORK ENVIRONMENT. YOU SHALL MAKE NO CLAIM AGAINST LICENSOR FOR LOST DATA, RUN TIME, INACCURATE OUTPUT, WORK DELAYS OR LOST PROFITS RESULTING FROM THE USE OR OPERATION OF THE SOFTWARE.

5.2Limitation of Liability. IN NO EVENT WILL LICENSOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOST REVENUE, PROFIT, DATA, OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION AND THE LIKE, OR FOR SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES HOWEVER CAUSED AND REGARDLESS OF THE THEORY OF LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF OR INABILITY TO USE THE SOFTWARE EVEN IF LICENSOR HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IN THE EVENT OF ANY OTHER DAMAGE OR ALLEGED DAMAGE, AND REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION (E.G. CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE, WARRANTY OR OTHERWISE) IN WHICH ANY LEGAL OR EQUITABLE ACTION OR CLAIM MAY BE BROUGHT OR ALLEGED AGAINST LICESOR, LICENSOR’S LIABILITY WILL BE LIMITED TO THE LESSER OF: (A) ACTUAL DAMAGES; OR (B) THE TOTAL AMOUNT PAID BY YOU TO LICENSOR HEREUNDER.

5.3Indemnity. Subject to Sections 5.1 and 5.2, each party shall indemnify, defend, and hold the other party harmless from and against any and all claims, actions, suits, demands, assessments, or judgments asserted, and any and all losses, liabilities, damages, costs, and expenses (including, without limitation, attorney’s fees, accounting fees, and investigation costs to the extent permitted by law) alleged or incurred arising out of or relating to any operations, acts, or omissions of the indemnifying party or any of its employees, agents, and invitees in the exercise of the indemnifying party’s rights or the performance or observance of the indemnifying party’s obligations under this Agreement. Prompt notice must be given of any claim, and the party who is providing the indemnification will have control of any defense or settlement.

6.TERMINATION.

6.1Termination. This Agreement will automatically expire: (i) upon Your license of a commercially released version of the Software; (ii) upon Licensor’s removal of the Software from the Apple App Store or Android Play Store (trademarks owned by their respective owners); (iii) for any reason or no reason upon ten (10) days written notice from the Licensor; or (iv) if You fail to timely provide reasonable feedback for the Beta program. Notwithstanding the above, this Agreement shall expire 180 days after delivery of the Software. This Agreement may be immediately terminated upon Your breach of this Agreement or if in Licensor’s sole opinion, the Software is likely to become the subject of a claim of infringement of any intellectual property right.

6.2Return of Software. Within ten (10) days after the expiration or termination of this Agreement, You will, at its expense, ship to Licensor and/or destroy (including purging from any system or storage media) all copies of the Software and any other Confidential Information. If requested by Licensor, You will certify in writing to Licensor that all copies of the Software and Confidential Information have been returned to Licensor and/or destroyed. Your access codes shall be disabled as of the effective date of termination. Any access or use of the Software after the date of termination is strictly prohibited.

6.3Survival. The rights and obligations of the parties under Sections 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.2, 7.3, 9 and 10 will survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

7.LICENSEE USE AND EVALUATION.

7.1Permitted Use. You hereby agree to use its best efforts in conducting “live” testing and evaluation of the Software. All expenses associated with the use and access to the Software are Your sole obligation, except for Support, as set forth in Section 1.3 above. Use or access of the Software after termination is strictly prohibited and will be considered a breach of this Agreement and a violation of intellectual property rights owned by Licensor.

7.2Exchange of Information. You will provide reasonable beta testing feedback on a reasonably timely basis as requested by Licensor (“Information”). Such Information exchanged will be related to comments, evaluation, feedback, usefulness, technical issues, errors, bugs, glitches, defects, perceived improvements, functionality, effectiveness, results, and all other information related to the access and use of the Software. The exchange of Information is intended to assist Licensor in developing the final commercial release version of the Software and gauge its effectiveness and usefulness in the trade. You will identify those individuals who are responsible for the exchange of Information. Any Information, and the resulting improvement, upgrade, or creation of other goods or services, belongs solely to the Licensor and You hereby assign Your entire right, title, and interest in and to the Information, except You retain to the right to use such Information for its internal use only.

7.3Publicity. You permit Licensor to publicize Information. All Your Confidential Information will not be publicized in association with Your name but may be aggregated with other beta partners’ Information for unlimited use by Licensor internally and limited external use in Licensor’s marketing and advertising efforts. You hereby agree to Licensor’s right to publicize quotes or statements that positively reflect on the Software made by You with Your name attached to such statements or quotes.

8.LICENSOR ASSISTANCE. Licensor may, but is not obligated to, provide Support pursuant to Section 1.3 above. Further, Licensor may assist You in the initial set-up, use, and importation of data used to populate the database.

9.OPTION TO LICENSE. At the expiration of this Agreement and as further consideration for Your agreement to beta test the Software, Licensor will license the initial commercial release of the Software to You at fifty percent (50%) of the commercial release license fee for one (1) year. You have thirty (30) days after the commercial release of the Software to exercise Your option to license the initial commercial release of the Software at the discounted rate set forth herein and upon the then current terms and conditions offered by Licensor.

10.GENERAL.

10.1Compliance with Laws. YOU AGREE TO COMPLY WITH ALL APPLICABLE LAWS IN CONNECTION WITH LICENSEE’S USE OF THE SOFTWARE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LAWS CONCERNING EXPORT CONTROLS AND INFRINGEMENT. YOU AGREE TO INDEMNIFY LICENSOR AGAINST LIABILITY TO THIRD PARTIES (INCLUDING GOVERNMENTAL AUTHORITIES) RESULTING FROM YOUR FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH SUCH LAWS.

10.2Injunctive Relief. You acknowledge that any breach of Your obligations under this Agreement with respect to the proprietary rights or Confidential Information of Licensor will cause Licensor irreparable injury for which the remedies at law are inadequate and therefore Licensor is entitled to immediate equitable relief in any court in addition to all other remedies provided by this Agreement or available at law or in equity.

10.3Attorneys’ Fees. In addition to any other relief awarded, Licensor in any action arising out of this Agreement shall be entitled to its attorneys’ fees and costs.

10.4Assignment. You may not assign or delegate Your obligations or duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Licensor. Any attempted assignment or delegation without written consent will be void.

10.5Binding Effect. All the terms, provisions, and conditions of this Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the parties hereto, their respective successors, permitted assigns, and legal representatives.

10.6Waiver and Modification. Failure by either party to enforce any provision of this Agreement will not be deemed a waiver of future enforcement of that or any other provision. Any waiver, amendment or other modification of any provision of this Agreement will be effective only if in writing and signed by the parties.

10.7Severability. If for any reason a court of competent jurisdiction finds any provision of this Agreement to be unenforceable, that provision of the Agreement will be enforced to the maximum extent permissible to affect the intent of the parties, and the remainder of this Agreement will continue in full force and effect.

10.8Controlling Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement and any action related thereto shall be governed, controlled, interpreted and defined by and under the laws of the State of Washington, without regard to the conflicts of laws provisions thereof. The parties hereby expressly exclude the application of the United Nations Convention on the International Sale of Goods. Each of the parties hereto submits itself to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state and federal courts located in King County, Washington for the purpose of any such action.

10.9Headings. Headings used in this Agreement are for ease of reference only and shall not be used to interpret any aspect of this Agreement.

10.10Entire Agreement. This Agreement, including all exhibits which are incorporated herein by this reference, constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersedes and replaces all prior and contemporaneous understandings or agreements, written or oral, regarding such subject matter, except for any prior confidentiality agreements between the parties.

10.11Interpretation. The provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in accordance with their fair meanings, and not strictly for or against either party, regardless of which party may have drafted this Agreement or any specific provision.

10.12Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in two counterparts, each of which shall be an original and together which shall constitute one and the same instrument.

10.13Insurance. Each party agrees to maintain insurance in commercially reasonable amounts to protect itself and the other party to this Agreement from any and all claims of any kind or nature, made by anyone, that may arise form activities performed by or facilitated by this Agreement, whether these activities are performed by that company, its employees, agents, or anyone directly or indirectly engaged or employed by that party or its agents.

10.14Cumulative Rights. Any specific right or remedy provided in this Agreement will not be exclusive but will be cumulative of all other rights and remedies.
